mainBoard.flavorText:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven Proverb
mainBoard.name: Elven Riders
mainBoard.originalText: Cannot be blocked by any creatures except walls and flying creatures.

rulings.text: Creatures with reach (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have flying, so they can't block this.

mainBoard.text: This creature can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

mainBoard.flavorText: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"
mainBoard.name: Elvish Archers
Forest

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.name: Forest
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
mainBoard.name: Giant Spider
mainBoard.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

foreignData.name: Hurrikan
foreignData.text: Der Hurrikan fügt allen Spielern und allen fliegenden Kreaturen X Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Hurricane
mainBoard.originalText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

mainBoard.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

mainBoard.flavorText: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

foreignData.name: Llanowarelfen
foreignData.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um G.
Spiele diese Eigenschaft wie einen Unterbrechungszauber.

mainBoard.name: Llanowar Elves
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add {G} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

foreignData.name: Lebensquelle
foreignData.text: Du oder ein anderer Spieler Deiner Wahl erhält X Lebenspunkte dazu.

mainBoard.name: Untamed Wilds
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for any one basic land and put it into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.
mainBoard.name: War Mammoth

mainBoard.flavorText: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, *King Lear*
mainBoard.name: Winter Blast
mainBoard.originalText: X target creatures become tapped. Winter Blast does 2 damage to each target creature that has flying.

rulings.text: Checks if the creatures are Flying on resolution and not on announcement. It’s not a targeting restriction.
Winter Blast can target tapped creatures. If they have flying, the second part of the effect will still affect them.

mainBoard.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.

foreignData.name: Lebendes Artefakt
foreignData.text:
Lege eine Lebens-Spielmarke auf das Artefakt für jeden Lebenspunkt, den Du verlierst.
0: Entferne während Deiner Versorgungsphase eine Lebensmarke vom Artefakt und gewinne einen Lebenspunkt zurück. Du kannst während jeder Deiner Versorgungsphasen nur eine Lebensmarke umwandeln.

sideBoard.name: Living Artifact
sideBoard.originalText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During your upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter during each of your upkeeps.

rulings.text: Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.
You can cast it targeting your opponent's artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.

sideBoard.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on this Aura.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from this Aura. If you do, you gain 1 life.

foreignData.name: Seelenruhe
foreignData.text: Alle Verzauberungen verlieren ihre Wirkung und gehen auf den Friedhof.

sideBoard.name: Tranquility
sideBoard.originalText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

sideBoard.flavorText: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken
sideBoard.name: Wall of Brambles
sideBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate this creature.

foreignData.name: Spinnennetz
foreignData.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +0/+2 und kann nun auch Kreaturen mit Flugfähigkeit blocken.

sideBoard.name: Web
sideBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain flying ability.
sideBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

sideBoard.name: Whirling Dervish
sideBoard.originalText:
Protection from black
Gains +1/+1 (use counters) at the end of each turn in which it does damage to opponent.

rulings.text: If Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent who later left the game before that turn's end step, its ability still gives it a +1/+1 counter.

Whirling Dervish's triggered ability checks to see if it dealt damage during the turn to an opponent of its current controller. If it dealt damage to player A, then player A takes control of it, the ability doesn't trigger.
Whirling Dervish's triggered ability gives it at most one +1/+1 counter each turn, regardless of how many opponents were dealt damage beyond the first.

sideBoard.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if this creature dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
